skill.name: pdf
skill.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/splitting documents, and handling forms. When Claude needs to fill in a PDF form or programmatically process, generate, or analyze PDF documents at scale.
skill.summary: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/sp...
skill.author: Azeem-2

security_audit.summary: This is a pure PDF processing toolkit. All code is standard Python using established libraries (pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab). Behavior matches stated purpose exactly - reading/writing PDFs, extracting data, and creating documents. No network calls, no external command execution, no environment variable access, no code injection paths.

content.value_statement: Need to extract data from PDFs, fill forms, or create documents. This skill provides comprehensive PDF manipulation tools for extracting text and tables, merging documents, and programmatically filling forms.
actual_capabilities: Extract text and tables from PDF documents using pdfplumber and pypdf
Create new PDF documents with custom content using reportlab
Merge multiple PDFs into one document or split PDFs into individual pages
Fill fillable form fields in PDFs programmatically
Add text annotations to non-fillable PDFs for form completion
Convert PDF pages to images for visual analysis
limitations: Requires Python libraries: pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab, pdf2image
Encrypted PDFs may require password for access
Scanned image-based PDFs need OCR (pytesseract) for text extraction
Form filling on non-fillable PDFs requires manual visual analysis

use_cases.title: Extract tabular data
use_cases.description: Pull tables and structured data from PDF reports for analysis in spreadsheets or databases

use_cases.title: Automate form filling
use_cases.description: Fill out PDF forms programmatically with data from other sources without manual entry

use_cases.title: Combine documents
use_cases.description: Merge multiple PDF files into single documents or split large PDFs into parts

prompt_templates.title: Extract text
prompt_templates.scenario: Get all text from a PDF file
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all text from the PDF document at [file_path] and save it to [output_file]. Use pdfplumber for best text extraction results.

prompt_templates.title: Extract tables
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all tables from [file_path] and save them to an Excel file. Each table should be on a separate sheet.

prompt_templates.title: Merge PDFs
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge the following PDFs into a single document: [list of files]. Save the result as [output_file].

prompt_templates.title: Fill form
prompt_templates.prompt: Fill out the PDF form at [file_path] with these field values: [field_values]. Save the completed form as [output_file]. First check if the PDF has fillable fields using check_fillable_fields.py.

output_examples.input: Extract all tables from report.pdf and save to Excel
output: Table 1 (page 2): Financial Summary - saved to Sheet1
Table 2 (page 5): Monthly Breakdown - saved to Sheet2
Table 3 (page 8): Year-over-Year Comparison - saved to Sheet3

best_practices: Validate PDF form fields before filling to ensure correct field IDs and acceptable values
Convert PDFs to images first when analyzing non-fillable forms for visual layout
Use bounding box validation to prevent overlapping annotations in form fields
anti_patterns: Attempting to fill forms without first checking if the PDF has fillable fields
Hardcoding font sizes without considering the entry bounding box dimensions
Skipping validation image inspection when working with non-fillable PDF forms

faq.question: What Python libraries are required?
faq.answer: Core libraries: pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab. For images: pdf2image, Pillow. For OCR: pytesseract.

faq.question: Can this fill fillable PDF forms?
faq.answer: Yes. Use check_fillable_fields.py first, then extract_form_field_info.py to get field data, then fill_fillable_fields.py to fill.

faq.question: How do I fill a non-fillable PDF?
faq.answer: Convert to images with convert_pdf_to_images.py, analyze visual layout, create fields.json with bounding boxes, validate with check_bounding_boxes.py, then use fill_pdf_form_with_annotations.py.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing is local. Files are read from and written to specified paths only. No network calls are made.

faq.question: Why are my form values not appearing?
faq.answer: Set need_appearances_writer to True for some PDF viewers. Also ensure field IDs match exactly and values are valid for the field type.

faq.question: How is this different from online PDF tools?
faq.answer: This runs locally with no data leaving your system. It enables automation and batch processing with precise control over output.
